com.clarionmedia.infinitum.context

Interface InfinitumContext

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    InfinitumAopContext, InfinitumOrmContext, InfinitumUiContext, InfinitumWebContext
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractContext, XmlApplicationContext, XmlInfinitumAopContext, XmlInfinitumOrmContext, XmlInfinitumUiContext, XmlInfinitumWebContext

    public interface InfinitumContext

    Acts as a container for framework-wide context information. This should not be instantiated directly but rather obtained through a ContextFactory , which creates an instance of this from infinitum.cfg.xml.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 05/18/12
    Author:
    Tyler Treat

      Adds the given InfinitumContext as a child context to this InfinitumContext.

    • Method Detail

      • postProcess

        void postProcess(android.content.Context context)
        Must be executed after the InfinitumContext has been initialized.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context used for post processing

      • isDebug

        boolean isDebug()
        Indicates if debug is enabled or not. If it is enabled, Infinitum will produce log statements in Logcat, otherwise it will not produce any logging. This value is also used by Infinitum's logging framework.
        Returns:
        true if debug is on, false if not

      • getAndroidContext

        android.content.Context getAndroidContext()
        Retrieves the Android Context for this InfinitumContext, which contains application-wide context information.
        Returns:
        Context

      • getBeanFactory

        BeanFactory getBeanFactory()
        Retrieves the BeanFactory for this InfinitumContext. The BeanContainer is used to retrieve beans that have been configured in infinitum.cfg.xml.
        Returns:
        BeanContainer

      • getBean

        java.lang.Object getBean(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves a bean with the given name. Beans are configured in infinitum.cfg.xml.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the bean to retrieve
        Returns:
        a bean instance or null if no bean has been configured with the given name

      • getBean

        <T> T getBean(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Retrieves a bean with the given name and Class. Beans are configured in infinitum.cfg.xml.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the bean to retrieve
        clazz - the type of the bean to retrieve
        Returns:
        an instance of the bean

      • isComponentScanEnabled

        boolean isComponentScanEnabled()
        Indicates if component scan is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if component scan is enabled, false if not

      • getChildContexts

        java.util.List<InfinitumContext> getChildContexts()
        Returns a List of the children contexts for this InfinitumContext.
        Returns:
        children contexts

      • addChildContext

        void addChildContext(InfinitumContext context)
        Adds the given InfinitumContext as a child context to this InfinitumContext.
        Parameters:
        context - the child context to add

      • getParentContext

        InfinitumContext getParentContext()
        Returns the parent context for this InfinitumContext or null if there is none.
        Returns:
        parent context

      • getChildContext

        <T extends InfinitumContext> T getChildContext(java.lang.Class<T> contextType)
        Retrieves a child InfinitumContext singleton of the given type.
        Parameters:
        contextType - the type of the InfinitumContext to retrieve
        Returns:
        the InfinitumContext singleton
        Throws:
        InfinitumConfigurationException - if the desired type is not available

      • getRestContext

        RestfulContext getRestContext()
        Retrieves the RestfulContext for this InfinitumContext. The RestfulConfiguration contains configuration settings for the RESTful client.
        Returns:
        RestfulContext

      • publishEvent

        void publishEvent(AbstractEvent event)
        Publishes the given AbstractEvent to the event system.
        Parameters:
        event - the FrameworkEvent to publish

      • subscribeForEvents

        void subscribeForEvents(EventSubscriber subscriber)
        Registers the given EventSubscriber for events published by this InfinitumContext.
        Parameters:
        subscriber - the EventSubscriber to register for events
